labels.text: This work is an example from a series Huang Yong Ping developed between 1978 and 1988 that explores the notion of chance. Huang uses the alignment of these sculptural discs, inscribed with instructions and artistic qualities, to determine the style and content of paintings. During his production process, he uses a turntable and roulette wheel to choose the colour, section of canvas, and number of brushstrokes. In 1986, Huang founded Xiamen Dada, an artist group named after its location and the twentieth-century European avant-garde movement Dada which redefined art-making based on chaos and chance.

This work is from a series Huang Yong Ping developed between 1978 and 1988 that explores the notion of chance. Huang used the alignment of these sculptural discs, inscribed with instructions and artistic qualities, to determine the style and content of paintings. During his working process, he used a turntable and a roulette wheel to choose the colour, the section of the canvas, and the number of brushstrokes. In 1986, Huang founded Xiamen Dada, an artist group named after its location and the twentieth-century European avant-garde movement that redefined art making based on chaos and chance.
黃永砯在1978至1988年間，推出一系列探索藝術偶然性的作品，「轉盤」便是當中例子。他將多個轉盤層疊排列，每個均注明某些指示及藝術元素，藉以決定繪畫的方式和內容。創作期間，他透過轉動圓盤去選擇顏色、畫面佈局及筆觸重複的次數。黃永砯於1986年創立藝術團體「廈門達達」，以其發源地及20世紀歐洲前衛藝術運動「達達」而命名，在混亂性和偶然性的大前提下，重新詮釋藝術的定義。
黃永砯在1978至1988年間，創作了一系列作品，探索藝術的偶然性，而「轉盤」便是當中例子。他將多個轉盤層疊排列，每個均註明某些指示及藝術元素，藉以決定繪畫的方式和內容。創作期間，他透過轉動圓盤去選擇顏色、畫面佈局及筆觸重複的次數。黃永砯於1986年創立藝術團體「廈門達達」，以其發源地及二十世紀歐洲前衛藝術運動「達達」來命名，在混亂和偶然的前提下，重新詮釋藝術的定義。

medium.en: leather case, ink on wood, black and white photographic print

images.AltText: Open, black leather case containing a stack of six white discs with the largest on the bottom and the smallest on top. Inside the open lid is an annotated photograph of the case and its contents.
images.AltTextTC: 一個打開了的黑色皮箱內，盛載着六個白色圓盤，最大的一個置於最底，由大至小向上堆疊。皮箱的蓋子打開後，展示着一幅附有註解文字的照片，圖中的物件正是這個皮箱裝置。
